headline: Zebra Technologies (ZBRA) Is Up 13.7% After Raising 2026 Sales Outlook And Expanding Buybacks – Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: In the past few days, Zebra Technologies reported fourth-quarter 2025 results showing revenue rising to US$1,475 million while net income and earnings per share declined year on year, and issued 2026 guidance calling for fourth-quarter sales growth of 11%–15% and full-year growth of 9%–13% including acquisition and currency benefits. The company also expanded its share repurchase authorization by US$1 billion and highlighted portfolio shifts such as exiting robotics and integrating recent...

content.title: Zebra Technologies (ZBRA) Is Up 13.7% After Raising 2026 Sales Outlook And Expanding Buybacks – Has The Bull Case Changed?
content.summary: In the past few days, Zebra Technologies reported fourth-quarter 2025 results showing revenue rising to US$1,475 million while net income and earnings per share declined year on year, and issued 2026 guidance calling for fourth-quarter sales growth of 11%–15% and full-year growth of 9%–13% including acquisition and currency benefits. The company also expanded its share repurchase authorization by US$1 billion and highlighted portfolio shifts such as exiting robotics and integrating recent...

headline: ZBRA Q4 Deep Dive: Memory Costs, AI-Driven Upgrades, and RFID Momentum Shape Outlook
summary: Enterprise data capture company Zebra Technologies (NASDAQ:ZBRA) reported Q4 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 10.6% year on year to $1.48 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($1.48 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 3.2% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.33 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.
